verses.text: Elihu also proceeded , and said ,
Suffer me a little , and I will shew thee that \add I have\add* yet to speak on God’s behalf.\f + \fr 36.2 \ft I have…: Heb. there are yet words for God\f*
I will fetch my knowledge from afar , and will ascribe righteousness to my Maker.
For truly my words \add shall\add* not \add be\add* false : he that is perfect in knowledge \add is\add* with thee. \p
Behold, God \add is\add* mighty , and despiseth not \add any: he is\add* mighty in strength \add and\add* wisdom.\f + \fr 36.5 \ft wisdom: Heb. heart\f*
He preserveth not the life of the wicked : but giveth right to the poor.\f + \fr 36.6 \ft poor: or, afflicted\f*
He withdraweth not his eyes from the righteous : but with kings \add are they\add* on the throne ; yea, he doth establish them for ever , and they are exalted.
And if \add they be\add* bound in fetters , \add and\add* be holden in cords of affliction ;
Then he sheweth them their work , and their transgressions that they have exceeded.
He openeth also their ear to discipline , and commandeth that they return from iniquity.
If they obey and serve \add him\add*, they shall spend their days in prosperity , and their years in pleasures.
But if they obey not, they shall perish by the sword , and they shall die without knowledge.\f + \fr 36.12 \ft perish: Heb. pass away\f*
But the hypocrites in heart heap up wrath : they cry not when he bindeth them.
They die in youth , and their life \add is\add* among the unclean.\f + \fr 36.14 \ft They…: Heb. Their soul dieth\f*\f + \fr 36.14 \ft unclean: or, sodomites\f* \p
He delivereth the poor in his affliction , and openeth their ears in oppression.\f + \fr 36.15 \ft poor: or, afflicted\f*

Even so would he have removed thee out of the strait \add into\add* a broad place , where \add there is\add* no straitness ; and that which should be set on thy table \add should be\add* full of fatness.\f + \fr 36.16 \ft that…: Heb. the rest of thy table\f*
But thou hast fulfilled the judgment of the wicked : judgment and justice take hold \add on thee\add*.\f + \fr 36.17 \ft take…: or, should uphold thee\f*
Because \add there is\add* wrath , \add beware\add* lest he take thee away with \add his\add* stroke : then a great ransom cannot deliver thee.\f + \fr 36.18 \ft deliver…: Heb. turn thee aside\f*
Will he esteem thy riches ? \add no\add*, not gold , nor all the forces of strength.
Desire not the night , when people are cut off in their place.
Take heed , regard not iniquity : for this hast thou chosen rather than affliction.
Behold, God exalteth by his power : who teacheth like him?
Who hath enjoined him his way ? or who can say , Thou hast wrought iniquity ? \p
Remember that thou magnify his work , which men behold.
Every man may see it; man may behold \add it\add* afar off.
Behold, God \add is\add* great , and we know \add him\add* not, neither can the number of his years be searched out.
For he maketh small the drops of water : they pour down rain according to the vapour thereof:
Which the clouds do drop \add and\add* distil upon man abundantly.
Also can \add any\add* understand the spreadings of the clouds , \add or\add* the noise of his tabernacle ?
Behold, he spreadeth his light upon it, and covereth the bottom of the sea.\f + \fr 36.30 \ft bottom: Heb. roots\f*
For by them judgeth he the people ; he giveth meat in abundance.
With clouds he covereth the light ; and commandeth it \add not to shine\add* by \add the cloud\add* that cometh betwixt.
The noise thereof sheweth concerning it, the cattle also concerning the vapour.\f + \fr 36.33 \ft the vapour: Heb. that which goeth up\f*
